alert.note: Alert for Northeast Prince William Sound (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued January 10 at 4:59AM AKST until January 10 at 9:00AM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM AKST THIS MORNING THROUGH THOMPSON PASS... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions occurring. Additional snow accumulations of 1 to 2 inches. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph. * WHERE...Thompson Pass. * WHEN...Through 9 AM AKST this morning. * IMPACTS...Plan on hazardous driving conditions. Areas of blowing snow are significantly reduce visibility to one quarter mile or less at times. Dangerously cold wind chills as low as 40 below zero continue this morning. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Conditions will improve rapidly by late this morning.
info.instruction: A Blizzard Warning means severe winter weather conditions are expected or occurring. Falling and blowing snow with strong winds and poor visibilities are likely. This will lead to whiteout conditions, making travel very hazardous. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you.If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
